title: Seeing Europe with Famous Authors, Volume 2; Great Britain and Ireland, Part 2
author: Francis W. Halsey
snippet: From Mainhill the highway descends slowly to the village of Ecclefechan,the site of which is marked to the eye, a mile or more away, by thespire of the church rising up against a background of Scotch firs, whichclothe a hill beyond.

title: Seeing Europe with Famous Authors, Volume 2; Great Britain and Ireland, Part 2
author: Francis W. Halsey
snippet: The parish minister was expectedat Mainhill.

title: Seeing Europe with Famous Authors, Volume 2; Great Britain and Ireland, Part 2
author: Francis W. Halsey
snippet: Four miles from Lockerby I came to Mainhill, the name of a farm wherethe Carlyle family lived many years, and where Carlyle first readGoethe, "in a dry ditch," Froude says, and translated "Wilhelm Meister."

title: Nineteenth century letters,
author: Rees, Byron Johnson
snippet: You also I must thank for your graphic picture of Mainhill and its neighbourhood.
